tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: to the voice of Yahweh your God
tn.text: Here the metonym "voice of Yahweh" refers to what he says. AT: "to what Yahweh your God says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: so as to keep
tn.text: "and obey"

tn.ref: set you above
tn.text: Moses speaks of being important or being great as if it were being physically higher, as on a higher hill. AT: "make you more important than" or "make you greater than"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: All these blessings will come on you and overtake you
tn.text: Moses describes the blessings as a person who would attack them by surprise or chase and catch them. AT: "Yahweh will bless you like this in ways that will completely surprise you, and it will be as if you cannot escape having him bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Blessed will you be
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in the city ... in the field
tn.text: This merism means that Yahweh will bless them everywhere. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: the fruit of your body, and the fruit of your ground, and the fruit of your beasts
tn.text: These idioms for "your children, and your crops, and all your animals" form a merism for everything the Israelites valued. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: the fruit of your beasts, the increase of your cattle, and the young of your flock
tn.text: This doublet is three ways of saying that Yahweh will make the Israelites' animals many and strong. AT: "all of your animals along with the calves of the cattle and the lambs of the flocks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Blessed will be
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will bless" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: your basket and your kneading trough
tn.text: Israelites used a basket to carry grain. A "kneading trough" was a bowl they used to mix the grain and make bread. AT: "all the food you grow and all the food you eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: when you come in ... when you go out
tn.text: This merism refers to all of life's activities everywhere they go. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: cause your enemies who rise up against you to be struck down before you
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "cause you to defeat the armies that attack you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but will flee before you seven ways
tn.text: "but they will run away from you in seven directions"

tn.ref: seven ways
tn.text: This is an idiom. The actual number could be more or less than seven. AT: "in many different directions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will command the blessing to come on you in your barns
tn.text: Moses describes Yahweh blessing the Israelites as if Yahweh were commanding a person to attack them by surprise. AT: "When Yahweh blesses you, you will be surprised by how much grain you have in your barns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: and in all that you put your hand to
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "and in everything you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will establish you as a people that is set apart for himself
tn.text: Yahweh choosing the people of Israel to belong to him in a special way is spoken of as if Yahweh put them in a place different from the place all other nations live in. AT: "Yahweh will make you a holy people that belongs to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: you are called by the name of Yahweh
tn.text: Here the metonym "called by the name of Yahweh" means belonging to him. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has called you his own" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your cattle, in the fruit of your ground
tn.text: This is an idiom. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:4]]. AT: "with children, animals, and crops." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: his storehouse of the heavens
tn.text: Moses speaks of the clouds from which the rain falls as if they were a building where he stores the rain. AT: "the clouds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: at the right time
tn.text: "when the crops need it"

tn.ref: all the work of your hand
tn.text: The word "hand" is a synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "all the work that you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: the head, and not the tail
tn.text: This metaphor describes the nation of Israel as an animal and means the Israelites will always be the leaders over other nations and never the servants following behind them. The Israelites will be superior in power, money, and honor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: will be only above ... will never be beneath
tn.text: The Israelites will rule over others but never have others rule them.

tn.ref: I am commanding you
tn.text: Moses is speaking to all the Israelites, so the word "you" is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: if you do not turn away from any of the words that I am commanding you today, to the right hand or to the left, so as to go after other gods to serve them
tn.text: Disobeying Yahweh and worshiping other gods is spoken of as if a person physically turned and went in a different direction from Yahweh's words. AT: "if you do not disobey what I am commanding you today by serving other gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: But if
tn.text: Here Moses starts describing the curses the people will receive if they disobey.

tn.ref: the voice of Yahweh your God
tn.text: Here the metonym "voice of Yahweh" means what Yahweh says. AT: "what Yahweh your God is saying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: then all these curses will come on you and overtake you
tn.text: Moses describes the curses as a person who would attack them by surprise or chase and catch them. AT: "Yahweh will curse you like this in ways that will completely surprise you, and it will be as if you cannot escape having him curse you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: come on you and overtake you
tn.text: Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:01|28:2]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: These phrases appeared earlier in the chapter. See how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:3-4]] and [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:05|28:5-6]].

tn.ref: Cursed will you be
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will curse you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in the city ... in the field
tn.text: This merism means that Yahweh will bless them everywhere. Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: your basket and your kneading trough
tn.text: The Israelites used a basket to carry grain. A "kneading trough" was a bowl they used to mix the grain and make bread. Translate as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:05|28:5]]. AT: "all the food you grow and all the food you eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: These phrases appeared earlier in the chapter. See how you translated many of these words in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:3-4]] and [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:05|28:5-6]].

tn.ref: Cursed will be
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will curse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the fruit of your body, the fruit of your ground
tn.text: This is an idiom for "your children, your crops." Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:03|28:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the increase of your cattle, and the young of your flock
tn.text: This doublet is two ways of saying that Yahweh will make the Israelites' animals many and strong. AT: "the calves of the cattle and the lambs of the flocks" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: when you come in ... when you go out
tn.text: This merism refers to all of life's activities everywhere they go. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:05|28:6]] (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: curses, confusion, and rebukes
tn.text: "disasters, fear, and frustration"

tn.ref: in all that you put your hand to
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "in everything you do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: until you are destroyed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until your enemies destroy you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: forsaken me
tn.text: Here "me" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: cling to you
tn.text: "remain on you"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: infectious diseases, with fever, with inflammation
tn.text: "diseases and burning fevers that will make you weak." These all refer to diseases that cause people to grow weak and die.

tn.ref: with drought
tn.text: "with lack of rain"

tn.ref: mildew
tn.text: mold that grows on crops and causes them to rot

tn.ref: These will pursue you
tn.text: Moses speaks of the bad things that would happen to the Israelites as if they were people or animals who would chase after the Israelites. AT: "You will suffer from them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: skies ... will be bronze
tn.text: Moses speaks of the skies being like bronze because there will be no rain. AT: "skies ... will give no rain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the earth ... will be iron
tn.text: Moses speaks of the earth being like iron because no crops will grow. AT: "nothing will grow from the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will make the rain of your land into powder and dust
tn.text: "instead of rain, Yahweh will send sandstorms"

tn.ref: until you are destroyed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until it destroys you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will cause you to be struck down before your enemies
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will cause your enemies to strike you down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: to be struck down before
tn.text: Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:07|28:7]].

tn.ref: will flee before them seven ways
tn.text: This means the Israelites will be afraid and panic and run away from their enemies. See similar wording in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:07|28:7]]. AT: "you will flee in seven directions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: seven ways
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "in many different directions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: You will be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The peoples of the other nations will drive you from one nation to another" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: the boils of Egypt
tn.text: "the same skin disease with which I cursed the Egyptians"

tn.ref: boils ... ulcers, scurvy, and itch
tn.text: These are different types of skin diseases.

tn.ref: from which you cannot be healed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "from which no one will be able to heal you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You will grope about at noonday like the blind grope in the darkness
tn.text: "You will be like blind people who grope in darkness even at noonday." The Israelites will have a difficult life even when everyone else is enjoying life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: you will be always oppressed and robbed
tn.text: "stronger people will always oppress and rob you"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Your ox will be slain before your eyes
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You will watch as someone kills your ox" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: your donkey will be forcibly taken away from before you and will not be restored to you
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone will take your donkey by force and will not give it back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Your sheep will be given to your enemies
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will give your sheep to your enemies" or "I will allow your enemies to take your sheep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Your sons and your daughters will be given to other peoples
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will give your sons and your daughters to other peoples" or "Your enemies will take your sons and daughters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: your eyes will look for them the entire day, but will fail with longing for them
tn.text: Here "your eyes" refers to the whole person. AT: "you will grow tired as you constantly watch for them and long to see them again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: There will be no strength in your hand
tn.text: Here the metonym "strength in your hand" refers to power. "AT: "You will be powerless to do anything about it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: a nation
tn.text: Here the metonym "a nation" means the people from a nation. AT: "people from a nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you will always be oppressed and crushed
tn.text: The words "oppressed" and "crushed" mean basically the same thing. This can be stated in active form. AT: "they will always oppress and crush you" or "they will oppress you continually" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you will become insane by what you have to see happen
tn.text: "what you see will make you go crazy"

tn.ref: from which you cannot be cured
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that no one will be able to cure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: of horror, a proverb, and a byword, among all the peoples where Yahweh will lead you away
tn.text: Here the words "proverb" and "byword" mean basically the same thing. This can be translated as a new sentence. AT: "of horror. The people, in the places where Yahweh will send you, will make up proverbs and bywords about you" or "of horror. Yahweh will send you to peoples who will laugh at you and ridicule you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: byword
tn.text: a word or phrase that people use to shame others

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: but will gather little seed in
tn.text: "but will harvest very little food"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses continues describing God's curses if the people disobey him. He speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: but you will not rub any of the oil on yourself
tn.text: People would rub olive oil on themselves to make their skin healthy.

tn.ref: your olive trees will drop their fruit
tn.text: You may need to make explicit that the fruit drops before it is ripe. AT: "your olive trees will drop their fruit before the fruit is ripe" or "the olives will fall off your olive trees before they are ripe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: The foreigner who is ... He will ... to him
tn.text: This does not mean a specific foreigner but it refers to foreigners in general. AT: "The foreigners who are ... They will ... to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])

tn.ref: rise up above you higher and higher; you yourself will come down lower and lower
tn.text: This idiom means foreigners will have more power, money, and honor than the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: he will be the head, and you will be the tail
tn.text: This means foreigners will have more power and authority than the Israelites. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:13|28:13]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: All these curses will come on you and will pursue and overtake you until you are destroyed
tn.text: Moses describes the curses as a person who would attack them by surprise or chase and catch them. See how you translated something similar in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:28:01|28:2]]. AT: "Yahweh will curse you like this in ways that will completely surprise you, and it will be as if he is chasing you and you cannot escape having him curse you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: to the voice of Yahweh your God
tn.text: Here the words "voice of Yahweh" are a metonym for what Yahweh said. AT: "to what Yahweh your God said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: his commandments and his regulations
tn.text: The words "commandments" and "regulations" are a doublet for "all that Yahweh has commanded you to do." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: joyfulness and gladness of heart
tn.text: Here "joyfulness" and "gladness of heart" mean the same thing. They emphasize that the people should have been very glad to worship Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: He will put a yoke of iron on your neck
tn.text: This is a metaphor for Yahweh allowing the enemy to treat the Israelites cruelly and make them slaves. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: from far away, from the ends of the earth
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize that the enemy will come from a nation that is very far away from Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: from the ends of the earth
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "from places that you know nothing about" ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: like an eagle flies to its victim
tn.text: This means the enemy will come suddenly and the Israelites will not be able to stop them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: a nation with a fierce face that does not respect the aged and does not show favor
tn.text: The word "nation" is a metonym for the people of that nation. AT: "a nation whose people have fierce expressions, who do not respect the aged and do not show favor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: until you are destroyed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until they destroy you" or "until they leave you with nothing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses continues describing the army that will attack the Israelites if they do not obey Yahweh. He speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you in all your city gates
tn.text: Here the phrase "city gates" represents a city. AT: "your cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the fruit of your own body, the flesh of your sons and of your daughters
tn.text: Here "the flesh of your sons and of your daughters" explains the metaphor "the fruit of your own body." The people will be so hungry after the enemy army surrounds their city that they will eat their own children. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: the fruit of your own body
tn.text: This speaks of children as if they were fruit that was produced by the bodies of their parents. AT: "your own children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: who is tender and very delicate among you—he
tn.text: "who is tender and very delicate among you—even he." Moses is saying that not only those one would expect to eat their children, but even the last person one would expect to eat his own children will eat his children.

tn.ref: all your city gates
tn.text: Here "city gates" represents the cities themselves. AT: "all your cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: The tender and delicate woman among you ... tenderness—she
tn.text: "The tender and delicate woman among you ... tenderness—even she." Moses is saying that not only those one would expect to eat their children, but even women of noble birth and normally very gentle, whom one would never expect to eat their children, will eat their children. The word "you" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: who would not venture to put the bottom of her foot on the ground for delicateness and tenderness
tn.text: Moses is exaggerating. He is emphasizing that this noble woman is so rich and lives in such luxury that she would not allow herself to get dirty. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: for delicateness and tenderness
tn.text: The abstract nouns "delicateness" and "tenderness" can be stated as clauses. AT: "because she is so delicate and tender" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: within your city gates
tn.text: Here "city gates" represents the cities themselves. AT: "within your cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: that are written
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that I have written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: this glorious and fearful name, Yahweh your God
tn.text: Here the metonym "name" refers to Yahweh himself. AT: "Yahweh your God who is glorious and awesome" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will make your plagues terrible, and those of your descendants
tn.text: "Yahweh will send terrible plagues on you and your descendants" or "Yahweh will make sure that you and your descendants suffer from terrible plagues"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: He will bring on you again all the diseases of Egypt
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "He will make sure that you again suffer from the diseases of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: they will cling to you
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "the diseases will not stop, and no one will be able to heal you of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: every sickness and plague that is not written
tn.text: This hyperbole can be stated in active form. AT: "even sicknesses and plagues that I have not written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: until you are destroyed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until he has destroyed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You will be left ... you were like ... you did not listen
tn.text: Moses is speaking to the Israelites as a group, so all instances of "you" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you were like the stars of the heavens in number
tn.text: This means that in the past there were many Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: to the voice of Yahweh
tn.text: Here the metonym "voice of Yahweh" refers to what Yahweh says. AT: "to what Yahweh says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Yahweh once rejoiced over you ... multiplying you ... rejoice over you in making you perish and in destroying you. You will be plucked
tn.text: Moses is speaking to the Israelites as a group, so all instances of "you" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Yahweh once rejoiced over you in doing you good, and in multiplying you
tn.text: "Yahweh once enjoyed doing you good and causing you to become many"

tn.ref: he will rejoice over you in making you perish
tn.text: "he will enjoy making you die"

tn.ref: You will be plucked off the land that you are going into to possess
tn.text: Moses uses a metaphor to speak of the people as though they were fruit that Yahweh would take off a bush. This can be stated in active form. AT: "He will remove you from the land which you are entering to possess" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you are going ... scatter you ... you will worship ... you have not known ... you nor your ancestors
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: from the one end of the earth to the other end of the earth
tn.text: These two extremes together mean everywhere on earth. AT: "throughout the earth" or "all over the earth" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: there will be no rest for the bottoms of your feet
tn.text: Here the phrase "the bottoms of your feet" refer to the whole person. AT: "you will have to continually wander because you have no permanent home where you can rest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Yahweh will give you there a trembling heart, failing eyes, and a soul that mourns
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "Yahweh will cause you to be afraid, without hope, and sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Your life will hang in doubt before you
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "You will not know whether you will live or die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: because of the fear in your hearts
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "because of the fear you are feeling" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the things your eyes will have to see
tn.text: Here "eyes" refers to the whole person. AT: "the terrifying things I will force you to see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I had said
tn.text: Here "I" refers to Yahweh.
